moves.1. e4: This game started out as a direct contact sport with one exchange after another until only one of us was left standing...
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. g3 d5 4. d4 dxe4 5: This is blacks first mistake. And as a result, I earn a pawn
moves.16. Nxe4 g5 17. Be3 b6 18. a3 Be7 19. a4: By this stage, I realized that the only thing to do was to stay even and take advantage of little mistakes by capturing more pawns since major pieces seem to be one for one
moves.20. b3: So I developed my pawn structure
moves.20... Ng4 21. h3 Ne5 22. Bd4 f6 23. c3 B: This move was the turningpoint in the game.. I go two pawns up and force black into making a tactical blunder that earnns me position, and a bishop
moves.31. Kg2 cxb6 32. Rxd6: that nets me a bishop and then the castle to follow
moves.32... Kc7 33. Rxh6 Rh8: T first glance, this looks like a good situation for black, but actually it just plays into my hand
moves.34. Re6 Nd3 35. Nxg5 Nc1 36. Re3: with this move, the knight is essentually trapped
moves.36... Rd8: and with this move, the fork is on
moves.37... Kc8 38. Nxd8 Kxd8 39. f4: so my strategy is to march my pawns up the board and Black does the noble thing...black resigns...
